<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/14/netflix-hikes-prices-north-america-first-time-since-october-2020?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A scene from Don't Look UP " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-14/image-fa5a50e0302dc5ecbdd3ae6f9a4e6482afc658cb-500x281-gif/ezgif.com-gif-maker.gif">

<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Netflix </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Netflix announced its first <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/exclusive-netflix-raises-monthly-subscription-prices-us-canada-2022-01-14/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">price bump</a> in North America since October 2020, which is a tough break for whoever's Netflix account you're using.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The details for US customers:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The basic plan is going up by $1 to $9.99/month.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The standard plan (the company’s most popular) is being raised by $1.50 to $15.49.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The premium plan is increasing by $2 to $19.99.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The price hikes will roll out to new subscribers immediately, while existing subscribers will be notified 30 days before they have to fork over the higher monthly rate.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Netflix’s strategy</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Developing high-quality programming is expensive—for the amount they paid the <em>Don't Look Up</em> cast, they could have blasted the dang comet and saved the planet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And with subscriber growth slowing in North America, the company thinks the best approach for filling its content piggy bank is to squeeze some more quarters out of its existing customers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Netflix had earmarked $17 billion to spend on original and acquired content in 2021, and analysts expect the company’s content budget has only grown more this year.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With a stream of recent hits like <em>Red Notice</em> and <em>Squid Game,</em> and much-hyped, upcoming sports documentaries on the PGA and tennis, Netflix thinks it’s providing enough value to subscribers to raise prices and <em>not</em> trigger a mass exodus to the competition. Investors agreed, sending Netflix shares higher after the announcement.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Here’s how bullish Netflix is on its pricing power: For the first time ever, its standard plan ($15.49) is now more expensive than HBO Max’s ($15/month).</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>Netflix will likely elaborate on its pricing decision when it reports its Q4 earnings next Thursday. Analysts expect the company to have added 8.5 million new signups to its existing global total of 213.6 million.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/14/free-covid-tests-provided-companies-employees?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
You’ll find your Covid test in the employee portal
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/14/free-covid-tests-provided-companies-employees?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="A Delta Air Lines plane lands near a COVID-19 testing sign at Los Angeles International Airport" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9f4dd83af96934bce83aefb5715dd4cc6cf4f5ee-1024x630.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Mario Tama/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Access to a cramped workout room and unlimited Cheez-Its are no longer the pinnacle of workplace perks: Major companies like Google, JPMorgan, BlackRock, and Morgan Stanley are now <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/12/business/covid-testing-google-blackrock-morgan-stanley.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">laying out</a> robust free Covid testing options for employees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While some employers are beefing up testing capacity to bring staff back into physical offices safely, others are offering remote employees highly coveted at-home tests as a wellness benefit.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Google, which signed a deal with the same company that provides testing for the NBA, will cover the cost of special rapid tests that retail for a total of $2,161 per person for all full-time employees.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bankers at Morgan Stanley are allowed four free BinaxNOW tests every two weeks, which retail for roughly $40.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While office suites are flush with tests, classrooms…aren’t. Schools attempting to return to in-person instruction have faced frustrating testing scenarios, like hours-long wait times and shipments of expired tests. Students in NYC, Michigan, Boston, Chicago <a href="https://www.teenvogue.com/story/student-walkout-nyc-bos-oak?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">walked out</a> this week over insufficient Covid precautions, including a lack of testing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>the Biden administration said US households <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-households-can-order-4-free-covid-19-tests-starting-jan-19-white-house-2022-01-14/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">can order</a> up to four free at-home Covid tests from the website COVIDTests.gov starting next Wednesday. This ain’t White House Prime, though: Shipping will likely take 7–12 days.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUDIO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/public-health-experts-spotify-curb-joe-rogan?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Health leaders call Rogan's pod the real ‘Fear Factor’
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/public-health-experts-spotify-curb-joe-rogan?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Joe Rogan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/77262ddafe60876264d1ddf101041e812ef83926-4202x2802.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Alex Trautwig/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many public health experts think Spotify’s aura is “flashing red siren irresponsible.” 270 US doctors, scientists, health care workers, and professors <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2022/jan/14/spotify-joe-rogan-podcast-open-letter?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a> an open letter to Spotify, criticizing the streaming service for allowing its biggest star, Joe Rogan, to spread Covid misinformation on his ultra-popular podcast, <em>The Joe Rogan Experience</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The letter references a specific episode with virologist Dr. Robert Malone, who falsely told Rogan’s 11 million listeners that hospitals are financially incentivized to attribute deaths to Covid and that leaders have “hypnotized” the public into believing the vaccines work.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Calling the Malone interview “a sociological issue of devastating proportions,” the health experts urged Spotify to develop a policy to curb the spread of misinformation—since it does not appear to have one currently. YouTube, by comparison, yanked a video of the Malone episode from its platform shortly after it was posted for violating its rules. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Spotify locked in the exclusive rights to <em>The</em> <em>Joe Rogan Experience</em> in 2020 with a rumored $100 million deal, and the headaches have been as big as the price tag. At an all-hands staff meeting last September, CEO Daniel Ek reportedly <a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/xg8jq4/spotify-joe-rogan-transphobic?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told employees</a> he had held 10 meetings with groups and individuals who want to see Rogan off the platform.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Healthy New Year’s resolutions are great, but incorporating better, simple habits beyond January can take some work…unless you have <a href="https://athleticgreens.go2cloud.org/aff_c?offer_id=27&aff_id=1033&adv_unique1=partner&aff_sub=d35ctoffer-nutrition&aff_sub2=publisher&aff_sub5=newsletter&aff_sub3=morningbrew_d35ct_011522&aff_sub4=cac&adv_unique3=business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">AG1 by Athletic Greens</a>, that is.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just one daily scoop of AG1 = an easy, healthy routine that can help you start your day—and your year—off right.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Full of vitamin C, zinc citrate, ashwagandha, and 71 other vitamins, minerals, and whole-food sourced ingredients,</strong> AG1 is the foundational health drink designed to cover your nutritional bases without the need to take multiple products.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oh, and it tastes delish.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And if immune or gut health is top of mind for you in 2022 (you’re definitely not the only one), you’ll be psyched to know that <a href="https://athleticgreens.go2cloud.org/aff_c?offer_id=27&aff_id=1033&adv_unique1=partner&aff_sub=d35ctoffer-nutrition&aff_sub2=publisher&aff_sub5=newsletter&aff_sub3=morningbrew_d35ct_011522&aff_sub4=cac&adv_unique3=business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one scoop of AG1 supports your immune system, digestive health, energy, focus, and healthy aging</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ready to make routines, not just resolutions? <a href="https://athleticgreens.go2cloud.org/aff_c?offer_id=27&aff_id=1033&adv_unique1=partner&aff_sub=d35ctoffer-nutrition&aff_sub2=publisher&aff_sub5=newsletter&aff_sub3=morningbrew_d35ct_011522&aff_sub4=cac&adv_unique3=business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Start here with their special New Years offer</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/key-performance-indicators-january-15?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key performance indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/key-performance-indicators-january-15?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Silicon Valley opening credit scene" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7fdc67ce908cb54e2ee1c23178e494d6e2b94f6d-1136x852.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>HBO</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>When Americans aren’t playing pickleball, they’re <a href="https://www.npr.org/2022/01/12/1072057249/new-business-applications-record-high-great-resignation-pandemic-entrepreneur?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">starting companies</a>. A record 5.4 million new business applications were filled in 2021, the US Census Bureau reported this week. That’s up from the previous record of 4.4 million in 2020, and way higher than in pre-Covid times (3.5 million in 2019). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “CEOs shouldn’t be crybabies about it. They should just deal with it.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">JPMorgan boss Jamie Dimon is playing the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/14/banks-like-jpmorgan-are-finding-out-that-inflation-is-a-double-edged-sword-.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">world’s smallest violin</a> for the bank executives who complain about paying their employees more due to inflation. Still, those CEOs are probably right to be concerned—banks that reported their earnings yesterday warned that higher costs would eat into profitability, causing their shares to tumble.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Sometimes, life stinks. So this guy invented the nasal ranger. (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/13/climate/nasal-ranger-chuck-mcginley.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuonUktbfqYhkSVUaACbeWdkipwGLwv7G27U4w2X3KieYU3NJz_keAM2F8EjMY65udp0zwzGfDpdnAYMYecZTnKVZLlA_DE6huIeFk5AIZHQ49dzqA2lpmsyWA-19rDKwMCzpeO0ggezh70jcO2jrC_DehGYzZ1ow-esTflCr23EIwKbCA7Q1joE4haF9c8g8ETQQZyCKvO3qCwF9PbiFZxLd6Ao1XIJJSG2Z3I7cu_9bLlIkWR-RR2h_4G089NpfJNgdWa71JBQhc8L76q4DumlestEcmuhol8d8GIrV2g&smid=url-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>
</div>

color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nNetflix is raising prices \n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A scene from Don't Look UP \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=377 src=\"https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-14/image-fa5a50e0302dc5ecbdd3ae6f9a4e6482afc658cb-500x281-gif/ezgif.com-gif-maker.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if src=\"https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-14/image-fa5a50e0302dc5ecbdd3ae6f9a4e6482afc658cb-500x281-gif/ezgif.com-gif-maker.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNetflix \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNetflix announced its first \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/exclusive-netflix-raises-monthly-subscription-prices-us-canada-2022-01-14/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprice bump\u003c/a\u003e in North America since October 2020, which is a tough break for whoever's Netflix account you're using.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe details for US customers:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe basic plan is going up by $1 to $9.99/month.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe standard plan (the company’s most popular) is being raised by $1.50 to $15.49.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe premium plan is increasing by $2 to $19.99.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe price hikes will roll out to new subscribers immediately, while existing subscribers will be notified 30 days before they have to fork over the higher monthly rate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNetflix’s strategy\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDeveloping high-quality programming is expensive—for the amount they paid the \u003cem\u003eDon't Look Up\u003c/em\u003e cast, they could have blasted the dang comet and saved the planet.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd with subscriber growth slowing in North America, the company thinks the best approach for filling its content piggy bank is to squeeze some more quarters out of its existing customers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNetflix had earmarked $17 billion to spend on original and acquired content in 2021, and analysts expect the company’s content budget has only grown more this year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith a stream of recent hits like \u003cem\u003eRed Notice\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003eSquid Game,\u003c/em\u003e and much-hyped, upcoming sports documentaries on the PGA and tennis, Netflix thinks it’s providing enough value to subscribers to raise prices and \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e trigger a mass exodus to the competition. Investors agreed, sending Netflix shares higher after the announcement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHere’s how bullish Netflix is on its pricing power: For the first time ever, its standard plan ($15.49) is now more expensive than HBO Max’s ($15/month).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eNetflix will likely elaborate on its pricing decision when it reports its Q4 earnings next Thursday. Analysts expect the company to have added 8.5 million new signups to its existing global total of 213.6 million.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS unlimited Cheez-Its are no longer the pinnacle of workplace perks: Major companies like Google, JPMorgan, BlackRock, and Morgan Stanley are now \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/12/business/covid-testing-google-blackrock-morgan-stanley.html?partner=slack\u0026smid=sl-share\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaying out\u003c/a\u003e robust free Covid testing options for employees.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile some employers are beefing up testing capacity to bring staff back into physical offices safely, others are offering remote employees highly coveted at-home tests as a wellness benefit.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoogle, which signed a deal with the same company that provides testing for the NBA, will cover the cost of special rapid tests that retail for a total of $2,161 per person for all full-time employees.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBankers at Morgan Stanley are allowed four free BinaxNOW tests every two weeks, which retail for roughly $40.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile office suites are flush with tests, classrooms…aren’t. Schools attempting to return to in-person instruction have faced frustrating testing scenarios, like hours-long wait times and shipments of expired tests. Students in NYC, Michigan, Boston, Chicago \u003ca href=\"https://www.teenvogue.com/story/student-walkout-nyc-bos-oak?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewalked out\u003c/a\u003e this week over insufficient Covid precautions, including a lack of testing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ethe Biden administration said US households \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-households-can-order-4-free-covid-19-tests-starting-jan-19-white-house-2022-01-14/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecan order\u003c/a\u003e up to four free at-home Covid tests from the website COVIDTests.gov starting next Wednesday. This ain’t White House Prime, though: Shipping will likely take 7–12 days.—\u003cem\u003eMM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" Spotify’s aura is “flashing red siren irresponsible.” 270 US doctors, scientists, health care workers, and professors \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2022/jan/14/spotify-joe-rogan-podcast-open-letter?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e an open letter to Spotify, criticizing the streaming service for allowing its biggest star, Joe Rogan, to spread Covid misinformation on his ultra-popular podcast, \u003cem\u003eThe Joe Rogan Experience\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe letter references a specific episode with virologist Dr. Robert Malone, who falsely told Rogan’s 11 million listeners that hospitals are financially incentivized to attribute deaths to Covid and that leaders have “hypnotized” the public into believing the vaccines work.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCalling the Malone interview “a sociological issue of devastating proportions,” the health experts urged Spotify to develop a policy to curb the spread of misinformation—since it does not appear to have one currently. YouTube, by comparison, yanked a video of the Malone episode from its platform shortly after it was posted for violating its rules. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Spotify locked in the exclusive rights to \u003cem\u003eThe\u003c/em\u003e \u003cem\u003eJoe Rogan Experience\u003c/em\u003e in 2020 with a rumored $100 million deal, and the headaches have been as big as the price tag. At an all-hands staff meeting last September, CEO Daniel Ek reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en/article/xg8jq4/spotify-joe-rogan-transphobic?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold employees\u003c/a\u003e he had held 10 meetings with groups and individuals who want to see Rogan off the
